channel.title: Debugging
channel.description:
Basically I need a java-agent or something similar to debug a Java application (I do not have the application source). I wish for the debugger to work somewhat as follows:
[code] 2. SomeClass.someMethod(Object) was invoked where o = someObject 1. MainClass.main(String[]) was invoked where args = {} [/code]
Basically a stack trace. Any suggestions?

item.title: Debugging
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

You could check up on the following:

  1. Java Omniscient Debugger (http://www.lambdacs.com/debugger/)
    This debugger lets you rewind, so you can see what happened earlier.

  2. JConsole (http://java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/J2SE/jconsole.html)

  3. AspectJ (http://www.eclipse.org/aspectj/)
    AOP-programming that lets you add code to be executed either before or after your specified methods etc. You can have AspectJ compile the Aspects when the Java code compiles, or, as in your case, let an Agent and its Instrumentation do it all for you during runtime.

Read full topic

item.title: Debugging
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:5, topic:409347”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=510632.msg3705540#msg3705540 date=1313010654]
are you wanting to only print certain methods where you know they will have a consistant signature or do you want a print out for every method?
[/quote]
I want to print method names (and possibly their arguments) at the time they’re invoked.[/quote]Then you want a debugger.
http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.3/docs/tooldocs/solaris/jdb.html

Read full topic

@T41 wrote:

are you wanting to only print certain methods where you know they will have a consistant signature or do you want a print out for every method?

I want to print method names (and possibly their arguments) at the time they’re invoked.
